description: We delay the public events feed by five minutes, which means the most recent event returned by the public events API actually occurred at least five minutes ago.

description: This is the user's organization dashboard. You must be authenticated as the user to view this.

name: List feeds
description:
GitHub Enterprise Server provides several timeline resources in [Atom](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atom_(standard)) format. The Feeds API lists all the feeds available to the authenticated user:

*   **Timeline**: The GitHub Enterprise Server global public timeline
*   **User**: The public timeline for any user, using [URI template](https://developer.github.com/enterprise/2.16/v3/#hypermedia)
*   **Current user public**: The public timeline for the authenticated user
*   **Current user**: The private timeline for the authenticated user
*   **Current user actor**: The private timeline for activity created by the authenticated user
*   **Current user organizations**: The private timeline for the organizations the authenticated user is a member of.

**Note**: Private feeds are only returned when [authenticating via Basic Auth](https://developer.github.com/enterprise/2.16/v3/#basic-authentication) since current feed URIs use the older, non revocable auth tokens.

name: List your notifications

params.name: all
params.description: If `true`, show notifications marked as read.

params.name: participating
params.description: If `true`, only shows notifications in which the user is directly participating or mentioned.

params.name: since
params.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

params.name: before
params.description: Only show notifications updated before the given time. This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

description:
List all notifications for the current user, sorted by most recently updated.

The following example uses the `since` parameter to list notifications that have been updated after the specified time.

name: List your notifications in a repository

params.name: all
params.description: If `true`, show notifications marked as read.

params.name: participating
params.description: If `true`, only shows notifications in which the user is directly participating or mentioned.

params.name: since
params.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time. This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

params.name: before
params.description: Only show notifications updated before the given time. This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

description: List all notifications for the current user.

name: Mark as read

params.name: last_read_at
params.description: Describes the last point that notifications were checked. Anything updated since this time will not be updated. This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

description: Marking a notification as "read" removes it from the [default view on GitHub Enterprise Server](https://github.com/notifications).

name: Mark notifications as read in a repository

params.name: last_read_at
params.description: Describes the last point that notifications were checked. Anything updated since this time will not be updated. This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

description: Marking all notifications in a repository as "read" removes them from the [default view on GitHub Enterprise Server](https://github.com/notifications).

name: Get a thread subscription
description:
This checks to see if the current user is subscribed to a thread. You can also [get a repository subscription](https://developer.github.com/enterprise/2.16/v3/activity/watching/#get-a-repository-subscription).

Note that subscriptions are only generated if a user is participating in a conversation--for example, they've replied to the thread, were **@mentioned**, or manually subscribe to a thread.

name: Set a thread subscription

params.name: ignored
params.description: Unsubscribes and subscribes you to a conversation. Set `ignored` to `true` to block all notifications from this thread.

description: This lets you subscribe or unsubscribe from a conversation.

name: Delete a thread subscription
description: Mutes all future notifications for a conversation until you comment on the thread or get **@mention**ed.

params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

description: You can also find out _when_ stars were created by passing the following custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/enterprise/2.16/v3/media/) via the `Accept` header:

name: List repositories being starred by a user

params.name: sort
params.description: One of `created` (when the repository was starred) or `updated` (when it was last pushed to).

params.name: direction
params.description: One of `asc` (ascending) or `desc` (descending).

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

description: You can also find out _when_ stars were created by passing the following custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/enterprise/2.16/v3/media/) via the `Accept` header:

params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

description: You can also find out _when_ stars were created by passing the following custom [media type](https://developer.github.com/enterprise/2.16/v3/media/) via the `Accept` header:

name: Check if you are starring a repository
description: Requires for the user to be authenticated.

name: Star a repository
description:
Requires for the user to be authenticated.

Note that you'll need to set `Content-Length` to zero when calling out to this endpoint. For more information, see "[HTTP verbs](https://developer.github.com/enterprise/2.16/v3/#http-verbs)."

name: Unstar a repository
description: Requires for the user to be authenticated.

name: List repositories being watched by the authenticated user

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

name: Set a Repository Subscription

params.name: subscribed
params.description: Determines if notifications should be received from this repository.

params.name: ignored
params.description: Determines if all notifications should be blocked from this repository.

description: If you would like to watch a repository, set `subscribed` to `true`. If you would like to ignore notifications made within a repository, set `ignored` to `true`. If you would like to stop watching a repository, [delete the repository's subscription](https://developer.github.com/enterprise/2.16/v3/activity/watching/#delete-a-repository-subscription) completely.

name: Delete a Repository Subscription
description: This endpoint should only be used to stop watching a repository. To control whether or not you wish to receive notifications from a repository, [set the repository's subscription manually](https://developer.github.com/enterprise/2.16/v3/activity/watching/#set-a-repository-subscription).

name: Check if you are watching a repository (LEGACY)
description: Requires for the user to be authenticated.

name: Watch a repository (LEGACY)
description:
Requires the user to be authenticated.

Note that you'll need to set `Content-Length` to zero when calling out to this endpoint. For more information, see "[HTTP verbs](https://developer.github.com/enterprise/2.16/v3/#http-verbs)."

name: Stop watching a repository (LEGACY)
description: Requires for the user to be authenticated.
